about_the_game:
The Rundown

Euclid Valley is a difficult, fast paced, arcade rougelike where you play as a simple shape with the goal of surviving and achieving the highest score possible. Fight against the hoards of simple shapes in each level. Euclid Valley features a simple scoring system - the longer you live and the more enemies you kill, the higher your score will be. However, the longer you stay alive the faster each wave of enemies will spawn. 

Features

  • Fast Paced Combat

  • Thirty Unique Levels

  • Unique, Minimalist Artstyle

  • Various Interesting Enemies

  • Unlockable Powerups

  • Six Challenging Boss Fights

Enemies

Euclid Valley features a diverse cast of enemies. Some can fly while others will spawn more enemies to attack the player. As you progress through the game the enemies you encounter will get stronger and more complex. 

Bosses

On top of the normal levels there are also several boss fights scattered throughout your journey. The bosses in Euclid Valley feature a number of dangerous attacks which will force the player to be constantly moving to avoid them. 

Powerups

Each level has a powerup spawner near the center which will spawn a powerup occasionally, these powerups can be anything from a simple dash speed up to something as exciting as an entire new attack type.

Levels

Euclid Valley features various difficult levels, at first all the levels are locked and to open them you must score high enough on the previous level. The levels are split into a few different areas/difficulties: 

  • Red - Easiest

  • Blue - Mid Difficulty

  • Purple - Difficult

Secrets

While exploring the Euclid Valley you may stumble upon a green level. Green levels are special, they are hidden throughout the game, some are hiding in the game's Hub World, others await to be found within some levels. Some levels hide secret powerups to give you an edge in combat. Be sure to explore thoroughly to uncover all the secrets.

mac_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Mac OS 14.5
  • Processor: Apple M1
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: 8-Core GPU
  • Storage: 109 MB available space
mac_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Mac OS 14.5
  • Processor: Apple M1
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: 8-Core GPU
  • Storage: 109 MB available space

name: Euclid Valley

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel Core i5
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: GeForce GTX 560
  • Storage: 109 MB available space

  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel Core i5
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: GeForce GTX 560
  • Storage: 109 MB available space

short_description: Euclid Valley is a fast-paced, arcade game with some rougelike elements in which you fight for survival against all manner of shapes in a variety of small, difficult levels. Strive to achieve the highest score possible by staying alive and killing the hoards of enemies.
